entry.title: All Black! Be quiet! PURE BASE 500 Build pt.1
entry.content:
Translated from https://www.chiphell.com/thread-2192145-1-1.html.
Only for learning.
PS. It hard to translate all this article at the same time without mistake, so I split it into 3 parts. I’d also like to build something like this, I really love this style!

Foreword

I didn’t waste time though I was resting at home. So I helped build a system. After trying out builds with all kinds of lighting effects, a system with out lighting effects seems to be more out-standing. I used Ryzen 7 3700X + X570 + RTX 2080 platform. Considering that it has no lighting effects, I chose be quiet!‘s PURE BASE 500 for the case. It has a simple but elegant design and is pretty easy to install. For cooling, an air-cooling solution with out RGB was the best choice. It turned out to be extreamly quiet. And as for the power-supply, I used a HCG750 with 10 years waranty.

Here are the basic requirements for this build:

  • Powerful and can handle jobs for designing, video and photo editing and can provide a smooth experience playing PUBG or watching hi-res videos.
  • Look simple and does need to have any lighting effects.
  • Have good expandability and is easy to add additional memory and storage later.

Build specs:

ProcessorAMD Ryzen 7 3700X
MotherboardAsus STRIX X570-E GAMING
MemoryCorsair dominator platinum DDR4 3200 16GB x 2
Graphics CardEVGA GeForce RTX 2080 FTW3 ULTRA GAMING
SSD StorageWd SN750 1TB
Coolerbe quiet! DARK ROCK PRO 4
Cooling Fanbe quiet! SILENT WINGS 3 PWM 120mm x 4
Power-supplyAntec HCG750 Gold
Casebe quiet! PURE BASE 500 (with glass panel)

Build Show

45°

The front view of the case: it uses a round-cut design and has a quality brushed finish

be quiet!‘s logo

Front IO and button: 2 USB 3.0, start button and audio jack.

Top View of the case: A dust filter and cooling holes at the back of the case.

After removing the panel, you can see the top mounting holes for the fans. It also includes a magnetic dust filter which can stick to the top of the case to help improve cooling.

The back of the case:


A large filter at the bottom of the case:


Can be pulled out for cleaning.

On the left side of the case, there is a large piece of tempered glass. And on the right is steel.
After removing the panel:


45°


Main components. You can see it’s almost matt black and grey.

The HUGE cooler:

Memory:

A little cover for cable management. It has a be quiet! logo on it.

Graphics card:
The 3 slot card is really bulky. You can see the THICK heat sink and heat pipe.

RTX 2080:

Jumpers on the mother board:

There is plenty of holes at the top of the power-supply to provide cool air for the graphics card.

Three 12cm fans in the front of the case to intake fresh air:

The jumper cover where you can hide your pci-e power cord.

The cool air will be directly sent to the CPU cooler, and then exhausted by the fan on the back.

You cannot install the graphics card vertically.

Mounting holes on the back of the mother board: support dual 2.5 inch hard drive.

Cables:

Power-supply base:

Front hard drive base: you can install two 3.5 inch hard drive
